security_audit.summary: All 200 static findings are false positives. The scanner misinterpreted legitimate design token terminology (design system, generate, token) and console output text as security threats. The code is a pure Python design token generator using standard color manipulation (colorsys) with no network access, file writes, cryptographic operations, or external commands.

content.user_title: Generate design system tokens from brand colors
content.value_statement: Creating consistent design tokens manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This tool generates complete design systems including color palettes, typography scales, spacing grids, and component styles from a single brand color input.
actual_capabilities: Generates complete color palettes from a single brand color including primary, secondary, semantic, and neutral scales
Creates typography systems with modular scales, font weights, line heights, and letter spacing for three style presets
Builds 8-point spacing grids with semantic values from xs to 3xl for consistent component rhythm
Exports tokens in JSON, CSS, and SCSS formats for direct integration into any project
limitations: Does not generate dark mode variants automatically - requires manual adjustment of color values
Does not support custom spacing grids beyond the 8-point system
Does not include animation timing tokens beyond duration and easing presets

output: Colors: 5 palettes (primary, secondary, neutral, semantic, surface)

output_examples.input: Generate CSS variables for a brand color of #EF4444

best_practices: Use the modern style for clean, minimalist interfaces and classic style for traditional corporate designs
Export tokens in CSS format for direct use in web projects and SCSS for preprocessing with design token variables
Use the summary output first to review all generated tokens before committing to a specific format
anti_patterns: Do not manually edit generated tokens without updating the source brand color first
Do not mix different spacing systems (4pt, 8pt, 10pt) within the same project
Do not use semantic color tokens (success, warning, error) directly for brand-specific components

faq.question: What design token formats are supported?
faq.answer: Three formats are available: JSON for data interchange, CSS for direct web use, and SCSS for preprocessing workflows.

faq.question: How do I integrate generated tokens into my project?
faq.answer: Copy the exported tokens into your project's styles directory and import them or include them in your build process.

faq.question: Can I customize the typography scale?
faq.answer: The tool supports three style presets (modern, classic, playful) with predefined font family combinations.

faq.question: What color formats does the tool accept?
faq.answer: Accepts hex color codes with or without hash prefix (for example: #0066CC or 0066CC).

faq.question: How are color scales generated?
faq.answer: Color scales are generated algorithmically using HSL color space manipulation to create 10 steps from 50 to 900.

faq.question: Does this tool support dark mode?
faq.answer: Dark mode variants are not generated automatically. Manual adjustment of color values for dark backgrounds is required.
